args: A bit, yes. From time to time, I can see\nthe memories ingrained in this body.
The soul in the mimicry merged with the\ndemon and was lost. How could memories\nremain in a soulless vessel?
I suspect it means this body had powerful\nthoughts etched into it, so perhaps a\nbit of the soul remains in some way.
The miasma he was spreading WAS\nquite a thing, after all...
Shortly before the Satan Incident\nNorth Grastaea\nA Village in the West
Oh man, it's so late! If I don't get myself\nhome in a hurry, Mom's gonna chew me\nout again just like the otherâ€”
PUT ME OUT OF MY MISERY!
Huh? What the...? No, stop! STOOOOP!
...What? Why am I...?\nOh, who cares? It's all over anyway.
All of the villagers are... And yet, there's\nno trace of conflict. Could they all have\ndone it themselves?
I think Ryszarda is right. And based on all\nthe miasma floating around, it seems\npretty clear that we're dealing with...
Hello, Pinon. It's been a while. And it's\ngood to see Ryszarda and Raphael looking\nhale and hearty as well.
And just where have YOU been?
Oh, enough with the innocent act!
You're connected to Basileus by a Sigil.\nAnd since he's a traitor, I'll bet rupies to\ndonuts that you are too!
Naming me a traitor simply because\nBasileus is one is harsh judgment indeed.
Let me be clear: I have yet to betray\nanyone, and have no intention of being\nhostile to any of you at the present time.
Heck of a lot of weasel words in those\ntwo sentences, Michael.

Do not take my words to have some kind
of hidden meaning. You all know I am not
the type to skulk about scheming up
nefarious plans.

Am I? You humans have a terrible habit
of making things binary; the fact that
someone is not your enemy does not
then mean they are your ally.
But as I AM someone who drinks from the\nsame well as you all, allow me to give you\na piece of advice.

As you surmised, a fallen angel was
behind the tragedy in this town. Once the
miasma began to flow, the villagers all
met with exceedingly cruel ends.
And now the fallen angel moves east.
But there's a large town just east of here!\nIf he manages to make it there...
Yes, I recommend you move at speed.\nOur fallen angel isn't all that fast, but he\nshould still reach said town in a few hours.
Hang on, Michael! Where are you going?
Oh, we will meet again soon. For now,\nyou should focus on saving innocents over\nhanging around with me. Farewell.
That guy talks and talks and talks,\nbut I still never know what he's\nactually thinking...
Regardless, he's right. Michael can wait.\nRight now, we need to help that town.
I won't let that stupid fallen angel harm\neven one more person. Let's go!
North Grastaea\nA Town East of the Village
Not enough... It's still not enough...\nThe emptiness spreads! It consumes me!\nI beg you, satiate me with death!

...I...I can't hear their voices...
Ahh...the world is losing its color...
withering...my heart thirsts in agony...
Who did this...?
Sorry to have you come all the way here\nand then steal your moment, Prince.
Not at all. I'm just glad no one in the city\nwas hurt.
Thanks to you and Sandalphon's message!\nYou evacuated the people from the city for\nus in advance.
It was the least I could do to save all of\nthose innocent people.
Stow the congratulatory chatter, people!\nI don't think we're done here.
Pain... Delicious...\nBut it's not enough...\nIt's still not enough...
That fallen angel took Raphael's attack\nand is still up and around?
It's still moving even after that strike?\nI guess it takes more than that to knock out\na mimicry of Michael.
Mi...chael? Oh, right! I seal a demon!\nIt devours me from within!
I feel nothing, NOTHING.\nAll is emptiness. Sinking. Black.
So break me more! More! MORE!\nI'm sick of putting up with this boredom,\nthese constraints, this GLOOM!
He wants to be destroyed? Tch! I think\nthe miasma from that demon he's sealing\nhas made him go funny in the head.
There's nothing funny about it!\nNothing is interesting at all!\nNo fun! Worthless! BORING!
KILL ME CRUSH ME DESTROY ME FREE ME\nBREAK ME SMASH ME POLLUTE ME\nPROFANE ME RUIN ME END MEEEEEE!
Please... I'm so bored... Do it...
For a guy who's asking us to kill him,\nhe sure looks ready for a fight.
Welp, time to ignore all the gibberish\nand just get down to business, says me!
That's right. If we don't defeat him,\neveryone here will be in terrible danger.
Then we'll stop this fallen angel here and\nnow and save them all. Let's go Pinon!\nI am the apostle Ryszarda...
And I am the apostle Pinon...
And we shall administer Her authority!
